Statements and reports: investigations not concluded within 12 months
	Section 14 of the Health Service Commissioners Act 1993 (reports etc byHealth Service Commissioner for England) is amended as follows.
	After subsection (2H) insert—
		“(2HA)Where the Commissioner has not concluded an investigation before the endof the 12 month period beginning with the date the complaint was received, theCommissioner must send a statement explaining the reason for the delay to theperson who made the complaint.”
	After subsection (4) insert—
	“(4A)The general report laid under subsection (4)(a) must include informationabout—
		how long investigations that were concluded in the year to which the reportrelates took to be concluded,
		how many of those investigations took more than 12 months to be concluded,and
		the action being taken with a view to all investigations being concludedwithin 12 months.”
Commencement, extent and short title
	This Act comes into force at the end of the period of two months beginningwith the day on which it is passed.
	This Act extends to England and Wales only.
	This Act may be cited as the Health Service Commissioner for England(Complaint Handling) Act 2015.
